qas.question: Who was the senior priest of the household in Rome?
Which individual in the household was responsible for the Vesta cult?
Which ancient hero brought the lares cult to Rome?
From what city did Aeneas bring the lares cult?
What was put in the temple of Vesta?

context: A <a0_0>pater familias<a0_0/> was the senior priest of his household. He offered daily cult to his lares and penates, and to his di parentes/divi parentes at his domestic shrines and in the fires of the household hearth. His <a1_0>wife<a1_0/> (mater familias) was responsible for the household's cult to Vesta. In rural estates, bailiffs seem to have been responsible for at least some of the household shrines (lararia) and their deities. Household cults had state counterparts. In Vergil's Aeneid, <a2_0>Aeneas<a2_0/> brought the Trojan cult of the lares and penates from <a3_0>Troy<a3_0/>, along with the <a4_0>Palladium<a4_0/> which was later installed in the temple of Vesta.
